reviews.title: Nice event space
text: Volunteered here for an event fundraiser. Very nice venue - lots of space and different rooms to meet your needs. Nicely decorated and the building lends itself to a variety of functions. Washrooms were adequate and clean. This was our second time here and the guests all seem to enjoy this building.

reviews.title: An elegant venue for dinner and a show
text: We were guests at a social event hosted by GMP Securities.  The historic venue and staff hospitality were very good and the banquet meal followed by stage entertainment were very pleasant as well.  We would certainly be pleased to go there again, especially if some host was paying all the expenses.

reviews.title: The Carlu
text: Attended an event here - was excited to see the Carlu after many years of it being on our list of places to see in Toronto.  As there were many attendees, I found that they put us in a room that wasn't suitable for the presentation - it was hard to hear the presenters, which was unfortunate.  After the presentation, we were ushered into the adjoining room - which was beautiful.  However, the set up for the buffet, which included both desserts and appetizers, didn't allow for optimum circulation and as a result there were long lineups for the food.   The appetizers were wonderful, but it was difficult for the wait staff to replace dishes that were empty because of the lineups... it would have been better had they had more than one table for food with such a large group - and the room could certainly hold more tables. As a venue for a special function, like a wedding, it would be wonderful...

reviews.title: Not open to the public.
text: The Carlu has considerable historic interest. However, it's not open to the public, so you can't see it unless you're invited to an event there.

reviews.title: Very good venue
text: Came here for our sales kick off event.
Venue is very well located for downtown Toronto.
Event itself was excellent so highly recommend this venue.

reviews.title: Nice venue and good food
text: They rent their places out for big gatherings. They have very nice venue for different occasions. The services were very professional and the food is proper for places like theirs.

reviews.title: Excellent venue for a company banquet
text: We attended an annual company banquet celebrating employees and the Caru was a excellent venue.
It was nicely decorated and setup with company colours that highlighted the event.
The staff were everywhere but unobtrusive, when you wanted an hor d'oeuvres or drink they were right there.
The Mudmen and Julie Black played at the event and the sound in he hall was awesome, loud but the sound wasn't muddied or distorted at all.

Dinner was fantastic, boneless beef shortribs with Thai chicken roulade and potatoes. Very tasty, tender, and variety of flavour. The wait staff didn't let the wine glass get empty before offering a top up.
It was very well managed and the staff really made the difference compared to other events I've attended.

reviews.title: Beautiful and personalized venue for events
text: This is a place for people who like to have a big themed / personalized party. They have plenty of space at the premium location with direct subway access and near the key intersection (easy for uber / taxi services) so that people don't worry about drinking too much and having too much fun :)

reviews.title: Beautiful venue
text: Attended Swirl TO ,well organised across the three rooms .The Art Deco influence of the building shows through .The 7 th floor was specifically designed for Mrs Eaton for high society balls .This heritage building has been sympathetically renovated  .The food was excellent as was the music.

reviews.title: I attended a private event here which was fantastic
text: Three huge elegant rooms. We were greeted by some stunning hosts and whisked into a 007 themed party. A real classy feel. This venue also has a small stage.

reviews.title: One of the best examples of Art Déco interior
text: The Carlu is one of the best examples of Art Déco interior in the world. Recently restored, you can find it now in all its original splendor. It is rented for different events, but it can be visited on the occasion of concerts. Don't miss it.

reviews.title: Came here for an office party
text: This place is large and can easily handle a lot of people.
This party was 350.
I liked this place it felt elegant. Good layout.
The food was mostly finger food.
Had poutine, in a box, lobster mac and cheese, duck Cascadia, roast beef.....
It was very good. There were a few other things going around. All were good.
Plenty of spots to get something wet.
If you're doing a big event I think this is a good spot.
Even the music was good but they may have come from outside this place.
I enjoyed it here!

reviews.title: Beautiful Historic Venue dating back to the 1930's!
text: I've been attending a gala event held annually at the Carlu for a number of years now.  I love the history of this building, dating back to the 1930's when Eatons occupied the building and "the 7th floor" where the Carlu is located now and which was designed by Mrs. Eaton specifically to hold high society events.

Eventually, after Eatons moved to the Eaton Center, the 7th floor was closed and remained dormant and unoccupied for over 25 years.  Thankfully, new owners took over and restored it to its original glory.  The architecture is magnificent and it's beauty shines through in every room.

As far as the food is concerned, I've been to cocktail receptions and dinners here.  The food is over all quite good, although when I was there for our industry's gala event last weekend, I found the meal did not live up to its standards from the past events.

In any event, the Carlu is a wonderful venue located in the heart of College Park.  If you are in need of a hotel stay while there, the Courtyard Marriott is across the street and the Eaton Chelsea a short walk away.  If you have found this revue to be helpful, kindly let me know by clicking below.

reviews.title: BEAUTY WITH NO BRAIN
text: There were so much fanfare when The Carlu opened after an expensively restorative surgery. I was therefore quite gleeful when the wedding of my best friend's daughter was held there. It was a chance to see this hyped up event facility. My husband and I rode up in the special elevator in the College Park to the 7th floor. Voila! The Carlu is stunningly Art-Deco designed in 1930s/1940s style. It is simply impressive. However, that is. The underwhelming service was unforgiven as there were only a handful of servers servicing a wedding cocktail and dinner for 200 guests. The dinner was therefore served in an incredible snail pace. The food was nothing memorable to write or praise about. The service and the food were simply no match to this stunning surrounding. After dinner, the 200 guests were asked to join their first dance in the dance room. OMG! The 200 guests found ourselves jammed up against each other in a literally 4x4 room with standing rooms only. Dear Carlu, you have the beauty but unfortunately no brain!

reviews.title: Great spot for wedding
text: Our son was married recently at the Carlu.....what a wonderful space for a wedding and reception...the Art Deco style of the building and furnishings were amazing...the food was wonderful and service excellent...all in all, everything was  way above what we were anticipating. Our son had arranged for valet parking ( not sure what that cost) but it was well worth it as parking on Yonge St can be a challenge...Job well done

reviews.title: Classy Art Deco experience
text: What an amazing place to have a party. The service was great and the food was even better. This place was totally redone to match the initial opening back in the 1930's.

reviews.title: High end event
text: I have used this venue a few times and have never been disappointed. They can cater the ambience and vibe based on your preference.  Staff have always been great! Parking can be a challenge, especially if you have people attending from out of town. Although there is parking underneath the building - It just can be difficult to find if not familiar with the area. I have recommended the location a few times.

reviews.title: Lots of Fruits
text: Very friendly staff, good menu with lots of choice from sweat to hearty breakfast and a great amount of fruits :)

reviews.title: Attentive service and organization
text: Very experienced in managing high-end events, the staff are attentive and organized.  The venue itself is stunning.  Overall it's hard to be disappointed with this level of quality.

reviews.title: Art Deco event venue
text: This venue is located in College Park and the old Eatons building. It was almost forgotten and lost when it underwent an impressive and faithful renovation in the early 2000s to restore its art deco heritage. It's mainly used as an event venue for things such as the marketing awards or fashion shows. You can possibly get in during Doors Open although the lineups are long. One of the principals - Jeffry Roick - once designed/catered a dinner event I led at Bombardier in Montreal and it was quite unforgettable (metal rivetted plates, rack of lamb, cloud projections, etc.).

reviews.title: Great!
text: Kelly Clarkson film her video Already Gone here ... cool venue
